issue.title: Yii 2.0.36 + Inline Validators

repository.name: cms
repository.description: Build bespoke content experiences with Craft.

issue.body:
### Description

Running into some odd behavior with inline validators, I think its related the to the changes in Yii 2.0.36.

https://www.yiiframework.com/news/293/yii-2-0-36

First noticed that a couple of my custom inline validators were throwing an `UnknownMethodException` when referencing the current class via `$this` from within the validator. Move the validator out into it's own public function and all good.

It looks like commerce is also running into the same issue when using an inline validator within the Variant element:

https://github.com/craftcms/commerce/blob/efc4219e69167df56f28006e7dc816894b23cef4/src/elements/Variant.php#L749

Saving an order with line items throws the `UnknownMethodException` within the cp for me:

> Calling unknown method: craft\commerce\models\LineItem::hasStock()

Not sure if / where Craft might run into this too and if this is still possible with the new version of Yii (or if it is a Yii bug), but figured best to post here as a possible issue with 3.5, before reporting to commerce. 

### Additional info

craftcms/cms 3.5.x-dev 5f03758
craftcms/commerce 3.1.11

body: I was able to work around this by wrapping inline validators’ closures in another closure (craftcms/cms@9f4105ca265c2e778bd4c679f852dda2b18c5c9d), but the change should still at least be documented in the upgrade guide.

issue.title: Fix #18096: Fix InlineValidator with anonymous inline function not wo…

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
…rking well from EachValidator

body:
I used inline validators and js validation, that is broken with 2.0.36.

In the class "yii\validators\InlineValidator" the method "clientValidateAttribute" has a bug. The line:
`$method = $this->method->bindTo($model);`
must be:
`$method = $method->bindTo($model);`
@cs-crewsAndCaptains Probably worth posting that as a separate issue since it’s more of a direct bug as opposed to a gap in the documentation.

> @cs-crewsAndCaptains Probably worth posting that as a separate issue since it’s more of a direct bug as opposed to a gap in the documentation.

@brandonkelly okay, if have add: #18204
